definitions: an explosive consisting of a powdered mixture of saltpeter, sulfur, and charcoal. The earliest known propellant explosive, gunpowder has now largely been superseded by high explosives, although it is still used for quarry blasting and in fuses and fireworks.
shortDefinitions: explosive consisting of powdered mixture of saltpetre, sulphur, and charcoal, now chiefly used for quarry blasting and in fuses and fireworks

definitions: a fine green China tea of granular appearance.
shortDefinitions: fine green China tea of granular appearance
